body:
It means;

1. The citizens have some backbone, will act in self-interest, and will resist government overreach. They aren’t doormats for the authorities to walk all over.

2. The police force isn’t made of a bunch of bitches, they have neither too little nor too much power, and they will have each other’s backs in court (you want that).

3. A good balance between the existence of a government and freedom of the citizenry is at hand.

This is a thing that should just be. Organized crime should flourish and the police should battle them. The winning side should ebb and flow.
body_html:
It means;

  1. The citizens have some backbone, will act in self-interest, and will resist government overreach. They aren’t doormats for the authorities to walk all over.

  2. The police force isn’t made of a bunch of bitches, they have neither too little nor too much power, and they will have each other’s backs in court (you want that).

  3. A good balance between the existence of a government and freedom of the citizenry is at hand.

This is a thing that should just be. Organized crime should flourish and the police should battle them. The winning side should ebb and flow.
title: Organized crime and a police force battling it is a sign of a healthy society.

body: A healthy society is subjective. One could argue that warring factions within a society is unhealthy.
body_html: A healthy society is subjective. One could argue that warring factions within a society is unhealthy.

body:
In my observation this means:
Society, especially American society needs an 'other' to fight in order to function. 
The USA has always been in war since its creation, both in-group and out-group wars.
Present-day war seems against 'fascism' for the left and 'commies' for the right. 
An active war against organized crime would be more healthy for (US) society in terms of social cohesion imo
body_html: In my observation this means: Society, especially American society needs an 'other' to fight in order to function. The USA has always been in war since its creation, both in-group and out-group wars. Present-day war seems against 'fascism' for the left and 'commies' for the right. An active war against organized crime would be more healthy for (US) society in terms of social cohesion imo

body:
> and a police force battling it

... which we don't have. Police forces are getting walked all over by Burn Loot Murder thugs.

> they will have each other’s backs in court (you want that)

No, I don't. I want police to be accountable for its actions. I don't want them to be able to hurt random citizens, e.g. me, and get away with it, like they did Ryan Whitaker.

body:
> If the police don’t have each other’s backs, the risk of the job is too great. 

Tell that to the armed forces, in which they do report other soldiers who fuck up (at least to the point of endangering others).

What this proves: making your forces unaccountable is not required for people to not consider the risk too great.

Besides, having no police force is preferable to having a police force that will randomly kill citizens at its convenience.
body_html:

parent.body:
> If the police don’t have each other’s backs, the risk of the job is too great. 

Tell that to the armed forces, in which they do report other soldiers who fuck up (at least to the point of endangering others).

What this proves: making your forces unaccountable is not required for people to not consider the risk too great.

Besides, having no police force is preferable to having a police force that will randomly kill citizens at its convenience.
parent.body_html:
If the police don’t have each other’s backs, the risk of the job is too great.

Tell that to the armed forces, in which they do report other soldiers who fuck up (at least to the point of endangering others).

What this proves: making your forces unaccountable is not required for people to not consider the risk too great.

Besides, having no police force is preferable to having a police force that will randomly kill citizens at its convenience.

post.body:
It means;

1. The citizens have some backbone, will act in self-interest, and will resist government overreach. They aren’t doormats for the authorities to walk all over.

2. The police force isn’t made of a bunch of bitches, they have neither too little nor too much power, and they will have each other’s backs in court (you want that).

3. A good balance between the existence of a government and freedom of the citizenry is at hand.

This is a thing that should just be. Organized crime should flourish and the police should battle them. The winning side should ebb and flow.
post.body_html:
It means;

  1. The citizens have some backbone, will act in self-interest, and will resist government overreach. They aren’t doormats for the authorities to walk all over.

  2. The police force isn’t made of a bunch of bitches, they have neither too little nor too much power, and they will have each other’s backs in court (you want that).

  3. A good balance between the existence of a government and freedom of the citizenry is at hand.

This is a thing that should just be. Organized crime should flourish and the police should battle them. The winning side should ebb and flow.
post.title: Organized crime and a police force battling it is a sign of a healthy society.

author.bio: 12/08/2021 The administrators are no longer committed to free speech on this website, but they will continue to develop the software so that anyone who is interested in hosting a free speech website can do so. Rest in peace, Ruqqus. It was nice.
author.bio_html: 12/08/2021 The administrators are no longer committed to free speech on this website, but they will continue to develop the software so that anyone who is interested in hosting a free speech website can do so. Rest in peace, Ruqqus. It was nice.

body:
> Soldiers go expecting to die

... no they don't. I have no idea who told you this rubbish, but it's nonsensical. They acknowledge that there is a risk, they don't expect it as a certainty, or else few, if any, would sign up. Do you actually think all 1,385,727 (as of 2020) of the men and women who are in the United States Armed Forces signed up so they could die? People don't want to die (at least not sane people).

Police officers also face this risk, and to not acknowledge it is optimistic at best, and negligent and moronic at worst.
body_html:
Soldiers go expecting to die

... no they don't. I have no idea who told you this rubbish, but it's nonsensical. They acknowledge that there is a risk, they don't expect it as a certainty, or else few, if any, would sign up. Do you actually think all 1,385,727 (as of 2020) of the men and women who are in the United States Armed Forces signed up so they could die? People don't want to die (at least not sane people).

Police officers also face this risk, and to not acknowledge it is optimistic at best, and negligent and moronic at worst.

parent.body:
Soldiers go expecting to die. Police officers don’t.

Police currently have nothing to mitigate the risk and they’re quitting in droves.

author.bio: Warrior of God, Helper of Man, Agitator of Souls.  Raised on computers, now living as a nomad.
author.bio_html: Warrior of God, Helper of Man, Agitator of Souls. Raised on computers, now living as a nomad.

body:
If crime becomes organized then the war has already tipped decidedly in their favor, leaving the realm of what should be considered healthy in society.

There's a reason crime is crime (putting aside the insanity of our legal system), and that is because crime is detrimental to society at large, so how can you say we want such people to flourish?
body_html:
If crime becomes organized then the war has already tipped decidedly in their favor, leaving the realm of what should be considered healthy in society.

There's a reason crime is crime (putting aside the insanity of our legal system), and that is because crime is detrimental to society at large, so how can you say we want such people to flourish?

body:
> It gives people more options for acting in their self-interest.

Unless your interests happen to oppose that of the smart criminals. Than you have much less options for acting in your own self-interest, and thinking outside the box will be punishable by death

body:
>The police force isn’t made of a bunch of bitches, they have neither too little nor too much power, and they will have each other’s backs in court (you want that)

No I don't. Especially when they have each others' backs in courts, that means that they have a higher chance of getting away with something like murder of Duncan Lemp.
